author: rooneg
msg: On the fs-atomic-renames branch:
* subversion/libsvn_fs_base/notes/atomic-moves-proposal.txt: Remove some
stuff that's done and add a note about stuff I'm finding that doesn't
work quite right once renames are part of the equation.

author: rooneg
msg: On the fs-atomic-renames branch:
I can't resist, add basic support for renames to the log code so that
we can for the first time actually see the results of a rename in the
command line client.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/log.c
(detect_changed): Set action to 'V' for svn_fs_path_change_move, and
treat 'V' as an action that has a copyfrom path/rev.

author: rooneg
msg: On the fs-atomic-renames branch:
Take the somewhat controversial step of making svn_fs_copied_from work
with renames.  It's unclear if this is conceptually what we want to be
doing, since the node wasn't really copied, it was moved, but this is
the easiest way to get things like 'svn log' working with moves and we
can argue about the desired semantics later.
* subversion/tests/libsvn_fs/fs-test.c
(move_copied_from_test): New test.
(test_funcs): Run the test.
* subversion/libsvn_fs_base/tree.c
(txn_body_copied_from): Handle the case when the node in question
was moved into its present location, not copied.

author: rooneg
msg: On the fs-atomic-renames branch:
* subversion/libsvn_fs_base/notes/atomic-moves-proposal.txt: Update the
notes about the "carry around delayed move ID" question to include the
current half-hearted solution to the problem.

author: maxb
msg: * subversion/bindings/swig/svn_client.i: Temporary kludge to stop wrapping
svn_diff.h APIs unintentionally.
